LONDON: Poor diet is a major cause behind the COVID-19 deaths and the Indians must urgently cut down on ultra-processed food to build resilience against the deadly virus, a leading Indian-origin cardiologist in the UK has cautioned.

articles.author: New York Times
articles.title: What if we already have a coronavirus vaccine? - Economic Times
articles.description: New study in a niche area of immunology suggests that certain live vaccines may, possibly, protect against coronavirus.
articles.content:
by Melinda Wenner MoyerAs the world waits for a coronavirus vaccine, tens of thousands of people could die. But some scientists believe a vaccine might already exist.

articles.title: First coronavirus case in France appeared in December: expert - ecns
articles.description: The novel coronavirus first appeared in France on December 27, 2019, said Yves Cohen, an intensive care chief of a hospital in Paris, in an interview with local media on Sunday.
articles.content:
Staff members of a private cleaning and disinfection company disinfect metro trains in Vincennes near Paris, France, April 30, 2020. (Photo/Xinhua)

articles.author: Express News Service
articles.title: Cancer patient dies of COVID-19 at Chennai hospital; Coimbatore doctors isolated - The New Indian Express
articles.description: The official said the doctors and health staff of Coimbatore medical college who came in direct contact with the deceased, have been isolated.
articles.content:
COIMBATORE: A cancer patient from Coimbatore succumbed to COVID-19 at Rajiv Gandhi Government General Hospital (RGGGH) in Chennai on Sunday.
